bug.short_desc: python-dnf-plugins-extras-local together with mock can be dangerous

long_desc.thetext:
I just tried to build a F23 package using mock on my F22, target was F23.
Afterwards, when running dnf update I suddenly had F23 packages to be updated, all comming from my _local repository, which had a huge mix with F22 & F23 packages.
I was not able to exclude that repository from updates.
I think this behavior is quite dangerous and should not be the default.
Fixed in commit: * 4f983db (HEAD -> devel, origin/devel) disable "local" dnf plugin [RHBZ#1264215]
mock-1.2.15-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-327a55296a
mock-1.2.15-1.fc22 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 22. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-0c713976fa

mock-1.2.15-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-ff0b113baf

mock-1.2.15-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-0c713976fa

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
